Title: Germany to exclude purchase of Russian LNG wherever possible
Description: The German government will take measures to exclude the purchase of Russian LNG wherever possible and is discussing this with energy companies. Germany is fast-tracking multiple floating and land-based LNG import terminals coming online between this winter and 2027 to replace the lost Russian pipeline supplies which used to represent up to half of Germany’s gas imports prior to last year.
Author: DE

Title: Egypt’s EGAS offers its fourth cargo for February, loading around mid-month
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS is offering one cargo that will load at the 7.2 mtpa Idku LNG export plant on Feb. 13-14 through a tender that closes on Feb. 6. This is the fourth February cargo that EGAS has offered since last week.
Author: CK

Title: Turkey’s Botas signs up for 1 mtpa of LNG over 10 years  from Oman
Description: Turkey’s state-owned Botas has become the latest firm to agree to a long-term contract for LNG supplies from Oman. The deal is for 1 mtpa over 10 years starting from 2025.
Author: CK
